review.title: A Paraconsistent Tableau Algorithm Based on Sign Transformation in Semantic Web
review.abstract: In an open, constantly changing and collaborative environment like the forthcoming Semantic Web, it is reasonable to expect that knowledge sources will contain noise and inaccuracies. It is well known, as the logical foundation of the Semantic Web, description logic is lack of the ability of tolerating inconsistent or incomplete data. Recently, the ability of paraconsistent approaches in Semantic Web is weaker in this paper, we present a tableau algorithm based on sign transformation in Semantic Web which holds the stronger ability of reasoning. We prove that the tableau algorithm is decidable which hold the same function of classical tableau algorithm for consistent knowledge bases.
histories: 11 pages, in Chinese; the 4th Chinese Semantic Web Symposium (CSWS 2010), Beijing, China
review.COMMENTS: 11 pages, in Chinese; the 4th Chinese Semantic Web Symposium (CSWS 2010), Beijing, China

metadata.title: A Paraconsistent Tableau Algorithm Based on Sign Transformation in Semantic Web

sections.text: It is well known that the ability of para-consistent approaches in the semantic web is weaker in this paper; we present a tableau algorithm based on the transformation of characters into SemanticWeb, which has the stronger ability to argue. We prove that the tableau algorithm is decideable, which has the same function of the classic tableau algorithm for consistent knowledge bases. Keywords: semantic web; dealing with inconsistencies; para-consistent reasoning; tableau algorithm is decideable, which has the same function of the classic tableau algorithm for consistent knowledge bases.
